TopicTitle: [AAR] The Grand Tour - Voyage To The Planets

Articles.Content:
My concern about this being published as a book is the fact that it draws from other well known sci fi stories. There may be a way around this, perhaps the source materials could be acknowledged in the blurb/about paragraph.

That's not necessarily a problem, although the distinction between 'inspired by' and 'copied' can be a tricky one to define. It's not in the same genre but if you've read 'The Sword of Shannara' by Terry Brooks, it is quite obviously inspired by 'The Lord of the Rings' (down to the level of analogous characters and plot sequences in places) but that didn't stop it being published and doing very well.

I confess (the shame, the shame!) to only being partway through 'The Grand Tour' and whilst it does seem to be inspired by '2001 - A Space Odyssey', my gut feeling is that it would be different enough to avoid any copyright problems - although Czo might want to remove some of the direct quotes. OK as homages on a fan-fic board, probably not so much in a published work. Of course my gut counts for precisely zip, so don't take this as any sort of advice.

I know Czo has mentioned this before but I'd be more concerned about getting permission from Squad and checking the terms and conditions for this forum, in case they include anything about Squad owning the copyright to anything posted here. If I remember correctly, the terms and conditions for mods are fairly reasonable but I'm not sure about stories, pictures etc.

Bigger problem with derivative work (if this is one - it's not that simple) would be Squad's copyright to KSP universe, for instance names of the planets.

The eventual payment/donation would be not for my writing (work) but for putting this all to one piece, that is editing and so on (service). Or it can be done like this: I'm uploading the whole pdf/e-book here and if someone wants to make donation, he do so

Anyways, right now there's still some work to do with the last chapter, so for the time being I'm concentrated on that.

This is a very good idea and it was already done once:

However, this would be HUGE. I can't even start to imagine how much work would it require to put it all together considering that for several hours of work you get maybe a minute or two of animation. And I'm not talking about brand new animation, rather about playing and recording everything in KSP - doing the models and so on would be an immensely challenging thing. The adaptation would have to be much shorter than the story obviously and a lot of subplots would have to be cut out along with some characters. All in all, it sounds great and if there's someone who would like to do something like this he can take my blessing and cooperation for granted. BUT make no mistake, it would mean dozens of hours of work and it would be ready probably in September/October at its earliest. I also think that short proof-of-concept scene would be a good way to check whether it would even look good.

Having said that, if there's anyone crazy and skilled enough to think about doing this, PM me please

It's rather complicated. Plus there's another problem - Squad is a Mexican company and I'm a citizen of Poland (EU). In Polish copyright law there's a distinction between derivative work and inspired work - the first one (to put it simple) requires the author of such work to get consent from the copyright holder of the original work to publish and distribute it. In case of inspired works, such consent is not needed. I don't know honestly is Poland and Mexico binded by any bilateral agreement or international convention in this aspect (me buying KSP is probably like 1% of the whole economical exchange between the two countries). So assuming "The Grand Tour" is an inspired work, basically if I make it clear that it is in fact inspired by KSP I would fulfill the requirements of due dilligence in that case - according to the Polish copyright law. I'm sure there could be some issues with EU law and/or international agreements or conventions.

But again, it's rather complicated.

I mean, the Grand Tour has always been here for us. Through the loss of our first community manager, through the resources disaster, through everything for the last few months this story has always been here to help us get through. And now it will be gone?!

I like to think of the grand tour as a record of the evolution of the forums, it's one of the main reasons why I'm anti-curse.

The KSP forums were maintained by the developers, and to be honest the best community I've ever seen across the entire internet, we have our own lore, our own idols, our own poetry, songs, inside jokes a rich history, full of horrific disasters (the 2013 April crash happened exactly 6 days before I joined IIRC) but also brilliant moments (the 0.23 waiting thread when we held the severs at hostage with all the traffic, about 10 posts every 45 seconds) and of course, the entire sub-community is part of a bigger community, if everyone who played KSP joined the forums tomorrow, yes for a short while the value of the community might go down, but after a week or so, we would have even more helpful, characterful people with even more stories to tell, which brings me back to the grand tour. This story is not of pixels changing colour and transistors flowing, it's about the spirt of community within a sub-community and Czokletmuss bringing us together and sharing his writing with us and allowing this amazing group of people who I've come to like flourish, even if it's a tiny amount, it's something, a insignificant something much like the proteus drifting through the inky blackness. Thank you Czokletmuss for this brilliant, awe inducing, trope-tastic tale. Thanks.
